x.description: the x coordinates from the (x,y) pair on the scatter plot.

y.description: the y coordinatey from the (x,y) pair on the scatter plot.

text.description: the text elements associated with every (x,y) pair on the scatter plot. If the scatter 'mode' doesn't include 'text' then text will appear on hover.

name.description: The label associated with this trace. This name will appear in the legend, in the column header in the spreadsheet, and on hover.

mode.description: Plotting mode (style) for the scatter plot. If the mode includes 'text' then the 'text' will appear next to the (x,y) points, otherwise it will appear on hover.

marker.description: A dictionary-like object containing information about the marker style of the scatter plot.

line.description: A dictionary-like object containing information about the line connecting points on the scatter plot.

fill.description: Used to make area-style charts. Determines which area to fill with a solid color.

opacity.description: Sets the opacity, or transparency, of the markers and lines of the scatter plot. Also known as the alpha channel of colors. The opacity can also be set in the 'marker' and 'line' objects.

xaxis.description: This key determines which xaxis the x coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'x' references layout['xaxis'] and 'x2' references layout['xaxis2'].

yaxis.description: This key determines which yaxis the y coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'y' references layout['yaxis'] and 'y2' references layout['yaxis2'].

error_y.description: A dictionary-like object describing vertical error bars that can be drawn with this trace's (x, y) points.

textfont.description: A dictionary-like object describing the font style of this scatter's text elements.

type.description: Plotly identifier for trace type, this is set automatically with a call to Scatter(...).

x.description: the x coordinates of the bars or the bar chart's categories.

y.description: the y data for bar charts, which is the length of thebars.

text.description: text elements that appear on hover of the bars

name.description: The label associated with this trace. This name will appear in the legend, in the column header in the spreadsheet, and on hover.

marker.description: A dictionary-like object describing the style of the bars, like the color and the border.

opacity.description: Sets the opacity, or transparency, of the markers and lines of the scatter plot. Also known as the alpha channel of colors. The opacity can also be set in the 'marker' and 'line' objects.

xaxis.description: This key determines which xaxis the x coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'x' references layout['xaxis'] and 'x2' references layout['xaxis2'].

yaxis.description: This key determines which yaxis the y coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'y' references layout['yaxis'] and 'y2' references layout['yaxis2'].

error_y.description: A dictionary-like object describing vertical error bars that can be drawn with this trace's (x, y) points.

type.description: Plotly identifier for trace type, this is set automatically with a call to Bar(...).

y.description: Array of the numbers from which the box plot describes.

name.description: The label associated with this trace. This name will appear in the legend, in the column header in the spreadsheet, and on hover.

boxpoints.description: If 'all' then the 'y' points are shown with the box. If 'outliers' then only the 'outliers' of the 'y' points are shown. If False then no points are shown

jitter.description: Width of the jittered scatter. If 0, then the boxpoints are aligned vertically, if 1 then the points are randomly jittered horizontally up to the width of the box.

pointpos.description: Horizontal position of the center of the boxpoints relative to the center and width of the box.

boxmean.description: If True then the mean of the y-points is shown as a dashed line in the box. If 'sd', then the standard deviation is also shown. If False, then no line shown.

whiskerwidth.description: Width of the whisker of the box.

xaxis.description: This key determines which xaxis the x coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'x' references layout['xaxis'] and 'x2' references layout['xaxis2'].

yaxis.description: This key determines which yaxis the y coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'y' references layout['yaxis'] and 'y2' references layout['yaxis2'].

type.description: Plotly identifier for trace type, this is set automatically with a call to Box(...).

z.description: The data that describes the heatmap. The color of the cell in row i, column j is mapped from the value of z[i][j].

x.description: If numerical or date-like, the coordinates of the horizontal edges of the heatmap cells where the length of 'x' must be one more than the number of columns in the heatmap. If strings, then the x-labels the heatmap cells where the length of 'x' is equal to the number of columns in the heatmap.

y.description: If numerical or date-like, the coordinates of the vertical edges of the heatmap cells where the length of 'y' must be one more than the number of rows in the heatmap. If strings, then y labels the heatmap cells where the length of 'y' is equal to the number of rows in the heatmap.

name.description: The label associated with this trace. This name will appear in the legend, in the column header in the spreadsheet, and on hover.

autocontour.description: If True, the contours settings are set automatically. If False, the contours settings must be set manually with the contours object.

scl.description: The color scale. The strings are pre-defined color scales. For custom color scales, define a list of color-value pairs, where the first element of the pair corresponds to a normalized value of z from 0-1 (i.e. (z-zmin)/(zmax-zmin)), and the second element of pair corresponds to a color.

zmin.description: The value used as the minimum in the color scale normalization in 'scl'. The default is the minimum of the 'z' data values.

zmax.description: The value used as the maximum in the color scale normalization in 'scl'. The default is the minimum of the 'z' data values.

xaxis.description: This key determines which xaxis the x coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'x' references layout['xaxis'] and 'x2' references layout['xaxis2'].

yaxis.description: This key determines which yaxis the y coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'y' references layout['yaxis'] and 'y2' references layout['yaxis2'].

type.description: Plotly identifier for trace type, this is set automatically with a call to Contour(...).

z.description: The data that describes the heatmap. The color of the cell in row i, column j is mapped from the value of z[i][j].

x.description: If numerical or date-like, the coordinates of the horizontal edges of the heatmap cells where the length of 'x' must be one more than the number of columns in the heatmap. If strings, then the x-labels the heatmap cells where the length of 'x' is equal to the number of columns in the heatmap.

y.description: If numerical or date-like, the coordinates of the vertical edges of the heatmap cells where the length of 'y' must be one more than the number of rows in the heatmap. If strings, then y labels the heatmap cells where the length of 'y' is equal to the number of rows in the heatmap.

name.description: The label associated with this trace. This name will appear in the legend, in the column header in the spreadsheet, and on hover.

scl.description: The color scale. The strings are pre-defined color scales. For custom color scales, define a list of color-value pairs, where the first element of the pair corresponds to a normalized value of z from 0-1 (i.e. (z-zmin)/(zmax-zmin)), and the second element of pair corresponds to a color.

zmin.description: The value used as the minimum in the color scale normalization in 'scl'. The default is the minimum of the 'z' data values.

zmax.description: The value used as the maximum in the color scale normalization in 'scl'. The default is the minimum of the 'z' data values.

xaxis.description: This key determines which xaxis the x coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'x' references layout['xaxis'] and 'x2' references layout['xaxis2'].

yaxis.description: This key determines which yaxis the y coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'y' references layout['yaxis'] and 'y2' references layout['yaxis2'].

type.description: Plotly identifier for trace type, this is set automatically with a call to Heatmap(...).

x.description: The x data that is binned and plotted as bars along the x-axis.

name.description: The label associated with this trace. This name will appear in the legend, in the column header in the spreadsheet, and on hover.

xaxis.description: This key determines which xaxis the x coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'x' references layout['xaxis'] and 'x2' references layout['xaxis2'].

yaxis.description: This key determines which yaxis the y coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'y' references layout['yaxis'] and 'y2' references layout['yaxis2'].

stream.description: The stream dict that initializes traces as writable-streams, for use with the real-time streaming API. For more help, see: `help(plotly.plotly.Stream)`or see examples here: http://nbviewer.ipython.org/github/plotly/Streaming-Demos

type.description: Plotly identifier for trace type, this is set automatically with a call to Histogramx(...).

y.description: The y data that is binned and plotted as bars along the y-ayis.

name.description: The label associated with this trace. This name will appear in the legend, in the column header in the spreadsheet, and on hover.

xaxis.description: This key determines which xaxis the x coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'x' references layout['xaxis'] and 'x2' references layout['xaxis2'].

yaxis.description: This key determines which yaxis the y coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'y' references layout['yaxis'] and 'y2' references layout['yaxis2'].

stream.description: The stream dict that initializes traces as writable-streams, for use with the real-time streaming API. For more help, see: `help(plotly.plotly.Stream)`or see examples here: http://nbviewer.ipython.org/github/plotly/Streaming-Demos

type.description: Plotly identifier for trace type, this is set automatically with a call to Histogramy(...).

x.description: The x coordinates of the x, y pairs that are binned and plotted according to their distribution.

y.description: The x coordinates of the x, y pairs that are binned and plotted according to their distribution.

name.description: The label associated with this trace. This name will appear in the legend, in the column header in the spreadsheet, and on hover.

scl.description: The color scale. The strings are pre-defined color scales. For custom color scales, define a list of color-value pairs, where the first element of the pair corresponds to a normalized value from 0-1 of the binned data and the second element of the pair corresponds to a color.

xaxis.description: This key determines which xaxis the x coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'x' references layout['xaxis'] and 'x2' references layout['xaxis2'].

yaxis.description: This key determines which yaxis the y coordinates in this trace will reference in the figure. 'y' references layout['yaxis'] and 'y2' references layout['yaxis2'].

type.description: Plotly identifier for trace type, this is set automatically with a call to Histogram2d(...).

x.description: The x coordinate of the annotation location.

y.description: The y coordinate of the annotation location.

text.descriptors: The text note that will be added with this annotation.

bordercolor.description: The color of the enclosing boarder of this annotation.

borderwidth.description: The width of the boarder enclosing this annotation

borderpad.description: The amount of space (padding) between the text and the enclosing boarder.

bgcolor.description: The background (bg) color for this annotation.

xref.description: This defines what the x coordinate for this annotation *refers* to. If you reference an axis, e.g., 'x2', the annotation will move with pan-and-zoom to stay fixed to this point. If you reference the 'paper', it remains fixed regardless of pan-and-zoom.

yref.description: This defines what the x coordinate for this annotation *refers* to. If you reference an axis, e.g., 'y2', the annotation will move with pan-and-zoom to stay fixed to this point. If you reference the 'paper', it remains fixed regardless of pan-and-zoom.

showarrow.description: Show the arrow associated with this annotation?

opacity.description: Sets the opacity, or transparency, of the annotation. Also known as the alpha channel.

align.description: The alignment of the text in the annotation.

domain.description: Sets the domain of this axis. The available space for this axis to live in is from 0 to 1.

range.description: Defines the start and end point for the axis.

showline.description: Defines whether or not to show this axis line.

linewidth.description: Sets the width of the axis line.

tick0.description: Sets the starting point of the axis.

dtick.description: Sets the difference between ticks on this axis.

ticklen.description: Sets the length of the tick lines.

tickcolor.description: Sets the color of the tick lines.

tickwidth.description: Sets the color of the tick lines.

nticks.description: Sets the number of ticks to appear on the axis.

tickangle.description: Sets the angle of the ticks in degrees.

gridcolor.description: Sets the axis grid color. Any HTML specified color is accepted.

autorange.description: Toggle whether to let plotly autorange the axis.

zeroline.description: Show/Hide an additional zeroline for this axis.

zerolinecolor.description: Set the color of this axis' zeroline.

zerolinewidth.description: Sets the width of this axis' zeroline.

titlefont.description: A dictionary for configuring the axis title font.

tickfont.description: A dictionary for configuring the tick font.
